snippet: The legislation would give the acting secretary of Veterans Affairs more authority to fire senior officials but also to expand access to health care for veterans stuck on long waiting lists.
abstract: Sens Bernard Sanders and John McCain reach bipartisan accord to give authority to acting Veterans Affairs secretary to fire senior officials and to expand health care access for veterans who do not live near medical facilities or have experienced long waits.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER
byline.contributor: Kendra Szabo contributed reporting from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: The legislation would give the acting secretary of Veterans Affairs more authority to fire senior officials but also to expand access to health care for veterans stuck on long waiting lists.

headline.main: Senators Reach Accord Easing Worries Over Veterans’ Health Measure
headline.print_headline: Senators Reach Accord Easing Worries Over Veterans’ Health Measure
